Package com.pulumiverse.vercel

Class CustomCertificate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pulumi.resources.Resource
      • com.pulumi.resources.CustomResource
        • com.pulumiverse.vercel.CustomCertificate
  • public class CustomCertificate
extends com.pulumi.resources.CustomResource
    Provides a Custom Certificate Resource, allowing Custom Certificates to be uploaded to Vercel. By default, Vercel provides all domains with a custom SSL certificates. However, Enterprise teams can upload their own custom SSL certificate. For more detailed information, please see the [Vercel documentation](https://vercel.com/docs/domains/custom-SSL-certificate). ## Example Usage 
     
 package generated_program;
 
 import com.pulumi.Context;
 import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
 import com.pulumi.core.Output;
 import com.pulumiverse.vercel.CustomCertificate;
 import com.pulumiverse.vercel.CustomCertificateArgs;
 import com.pulumi.std.StdFunctions;
 import java.util.List;
 import java.util.ArrayList;
 import java.util.Map;
 import java.io.File;
 import java.nio.file.Files;
 import java.nio.file.Paths;
 
 public class App {
     public static void main(String[] args) {
         Pulumi.run(App::stack);
     }
 
     public static void stack(Context ctx) {
         var example = new CustomCertificate("example", CustomCertificateArgs.builder()
             .privateKey(StdFunctions.file(Map.of("input", "private.key")).result())
             .certificate(StdFunctions.file(Map.of("input", "certificate.crt")).result())
             .certificateAuthorityCertificate(StdFunctions.file(Map.of("input", "ca.crt")).result())
             .build());
 
     }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • certificate

        public com.pulumi.core.Output<java.lang.String> certificate()
        Returns:
        The certificate itself. Should be in PEM format.

      • certificateAuthorityCertificate

        public com.pulumi.core.Output<java.lang.String> certificateAuthorityCertificate()
        Returns:
        The Certificate Authority root certificate such as one of Let's Encrypt's ISRG root certificates. This will be provided by your certificate issuer and is different to the core certificate. This may be included in their download process or available for download on their website. Should be in PEM format.

      • privateKey

        public com.pulumi.core.Output<java.lang.String> privateKey()
        Returns:
        The private key of the Certificate. Should be in PEM format.

      • teamId

        public com.pulumi.core.Output<java.lang.String> teamId()
        Returns:
        The ID of the team the Custom Certificate should exist under. Required when configuring a team resource if a default team has not been set in the provider.
